meanings: [동사] entrust (sb with sth / sth to sb), delegate (sth to sb), authorize (sb to do), commission (sb to do)

examples.korean: The job had to be delegated to an assistant. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 일은 조수에게 위임되어야 했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The job had to be delegated to an assistant. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Some managers find it difficult to delegate. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 일부 관리자들은 (권한을) 위임하는 것을 힘들어 한다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Some managers find it difficult to delegate. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: He was deputed to put our views to the committee. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그는 위원회에 우리의 의견을 전하도록 위임을 받았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He was deputed to put our views to the committee. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The central government devolved most tax-raising powers to the regional authorities. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 중앙 정부가 대부분의 징세 권한을 지방 당국에 위임했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The central government devolved most tax-raising powers to the regional authorities. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: a system of devolved government 듣기 Add to Wordbook 위임 정부제 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: a system of devolved government Add to Wordbook
